sen.j: 真妙寺（しんみょうじ）は、京都府船井郡京丹波町に所在する日蓮正宗の寺院。
sen.e: Shinmyo-ji Temple is a temple of the Nichiren Shoshu sect located in Kyotanba-cho, Funai County, Kyoto Prefecture.
Shinmyo-ji Temple is a temple of the Nichiren Shoshu sect located in Kyotanba-cho, Funai County, Kyoto Prefecture.
Shinmyo-ji Temple is a temple of the Nichiren Shoshu sect located in Kyotanba-cho, Funai-gun, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 山号は船井山（ふないさん）。
sen.e: Its Sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Funaisan.
Its Sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Funaisan.
Its Sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Funaisan.

sen.j: - 船井教会所として設立認可。
sen.e: - The establishment was approved as Funai Kyokaisyo (religious organization).
- The establishment was approved as Funai Kyokaisyo (religious organization).
The establishment was approved as Funai Kyokaisho (religious organization).

sen.j: - 船井山真妙寺として寺号公称。
sen.e: - Jigo (the name of a Buddhist temple) was officially named as Funaisan, Shinmyo-ji Temple.
- Jigo (the name of a Buddhist temple) was officially named as Funaisan, Shinmyo-ji Temple.
Jigo, (literally, "temple name"), which is the title given to a Buddhist temple, was officially named as Funaisan, Shinmyo-ji Temple.

sen.j: 開基は日蓮正宗大石寺第66世法主日達上人。
sen.e: The 66th Hossu (head priest) of the Nichiren Shoshu sect Taiseki-ji Temple, Nichidatsu Shonin (The Venerable Nichidatsu) was Kaiki (patron of a temple in its founding).
The 66th Hossu (head priest) of the Nichiren Shoshu sect Taiseki-ji Temple, Nichidatsu Shonin (The Venerable Nichidatsu) was Kaiki (patron of a temple at its foundation).
The 66th Hossu (head priest) of the Nichiren Shoshu sect Taiseki-ji Temple, Nichidatsu Shonin (The Venerable Nichidatsu) was Kaiki (patron of a temple at its foundation).
